result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Trotter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

re: commitment
Canceled due to Judges order.  Has 3 days to come to Clerk of Courts office to set up a payment plan for his fine and costs.  Emailed Stacy at the jail to return commitment.

Stacy from jail called back letting us know that the deft still would not be released because of another bond on another case.  Had her hold off on canceling and returning commitment until Judge comes back tomorrow, Per Judges clerk the Judge will give answer tomorrow.   Had to enter commitment again. records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Berman.  Case is resolved.  Enhancer - 2nd/subsequent offense is dismissed on State's motion.  Deft pleads guilty to the charge as amended.  Parties waive PSI.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $1,000 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 55 days work crew or 110 days KCJ.  Expungment hrg 9/17/15 @ 9am.
Plea hearing on September 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Attorney Berman is requesting 7/30/2014 Plea hearing be rescheduled as he is not available.  Plea hearing is rescheduled to 9/17/2014 at 9:30am.  NTBS by the Court.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Berman.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:34pm-  Attorney Berman states the matter is resolved & is requesting matter be set for a plea hearing.  Court grants request.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. David Berman. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-1-14 @ 2:30pm. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

112pm
  ADA J Krejcarek  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Berman.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on.  5/22/14 @ 830am.  Time limits tolled due to unavailabliity of deft.  Warrant vacated.  Reinstated Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

REINSTATED
